Entity Module

Enemy

class entity.enemy.enemy.Enemy(x, y, width, height)[source]

Base Enemy class with common AI behavior. Extends RectEntity for hitbox handling and collision.

x

Enemy’s x position on the map.

Type:

int

y

Enemy’s y position on the map.

Type:

int

state

Current state of the enemy (e.g. IDLE, CHASE).

Type:

EnemyState

detection_radius

Radius within which the player can be detected.

Type:

int

attack_radius

Radius within which the enemy can attack.

Type:

int

attack_damage

Damage dealt by the enemy.

Type:

int

path

Sequence of grid cells toward the target.

Type:

list[tuple[int, int]]

next_attack_time

Next allowed time for attack.

Type:

int

attack_cooldown

Time delay between attacks in milliseconds.

Type:

int

color

Debug color used for drawing the enemy.

Type:

Color

hp

Hit points of the enemy.

Type:

int

__init__(x, y, width, height)[source]

Initializes a base Enemy instance. Not intended to be used directly—meant to be extended by enemy type subclasses.

Parameters:

  • x (int) – X-coordinate on the map grid.

  • y (int) – Y-coordinate on the map grid.

  • width (int) – Width of the enemy in map units.

  • height (int) – Height of the enemy in map units.

can_see_player(player, game_map)[source]

Determines whether the enemy can see the player.

Checks both distance (detection radius) and line of sight using Bresenham’s algorithm.

Parameters:

  • player (Player) – The player object.

  • game_map (Map) – The current game map.

Returns:

True if the player is visible, otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

distance_to(x, y)[source]

Calculates the Euclidean distance to a target (x, y) position.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – Target X position.

  • y (float) – Target Y position.

Returns:

Distance to the target.

Return type:

float

draw(screen, camera)[source]

Draws the enemy’s current state indicator on the screen.

Parameters:

  • screen (pygame.Surface) – The surface to draw on.

  • camera (Camera) – The camera object to adjust position relative to screen.

Returns:

None

get_center(camera)[source]

Gets the center coordinates of the enemy relative to the camera, in screen pixels.

Parameters:

camera (Camera) – Camera object for coordinate transformation.

Returns:

(x, y) center screen coordinates.

Return type:

tuple[int, int]

heuristic(a, b)[source]

Calculates the Manhattan distance between two points.

Parameters:

  • a (tuple[int, int]) – First point (x, y).

  • b (tuple[int, int]) – Second point (x, y).

Returns:

Manhattan distance.

Return type:

int

move_toward_player(player, game_map)[source]

Moves the enemy toward the player using A* pathfinding.

Parameters:

  • player (Player) – The player instance.

  • game_map (Map) – The current game map.

Returns:

None

prepare_attack(current_time)[source]

Placeholder for attack logic. To be overridden by subclasses.

Parameters:

current_time (int) – Current time in milliseconds.

Returns:

None

take_damage(damage)[source]

Reduces enemy HP by a given damage amount. Transitions to DEAD state if HP falls below 0.

Parameters:

damage (int) – Amount of damage received.

Returns:

None

update(camera, player, game_map, projectiles, current_time)[source]

Updates the enemy’s behavior and position based on its state.

Parameters:

  • camera (Camera) – Camera used to offset screen position.

  • player (Player) – The player object.

  • game_map (Map) – The current map.

  • projectiles (list[Projectile]) – List of active projectiles.

  • current_time (int) – Current time in milliseconds.

Returns: None

class entity.enemy.enemy.EnemyState(*values)[source]
ATTACK = 3
CHASE = 2
COOLDOWN = 4
DEAD = 5
IDLE = 1
class entity.enemy.melee_enemy.MeleeEnemy(x, y)[source]

Enemy subclass for close-range melee attackers.

Extends:

Enemy: The base enemy class with AI and movement logic.

attack_radius

Distance within which the enemy can perform a melee attack.

Type:

float

color

Debug color for visualizing this enemy type.

Type:

Color

__init__(x, y)[source]

Initializes a MeleeEnemy instance with specific size and behavior.

Parameters:

  • x (int) – X-coordinate on the map grid.

  • y (int) – Y-coordinate on the map grid.

draw(screen, camera)[source]

Draws the melee enemy and its hitbox if debug is enabled.

Parameters:

  • screen (pygame.Surface) – The rendering surface.

  • camera (Camera) – Camera for coordinate transformation.

Returns:

None

prepare_attack(current_time)[source]

Prepares an immediate melee attack by switching to ATTACK state.

Parameters:

current_time (int) – Current game time in milliseconds.

Returns:

None

update(camera, player, game_map, projectiles, current_time)[source]

Updates the melee enemy state, performs melee attack when in range.

Parameters:

  • camera (Camera) – Camera for screen-relative coordinates.

  • player (Player) – Player instance.

  • game_map (Map) – Current game map.

  • projectiles (list[Projectile]) – List of active projectiles.

  • current_time (int) – Current game time in milliseconds.

Returns:

None

class entity.enemy.ranged_enemy.RangedEnemy(x, y)[source]

Enemy subclass that attacks from a distance using projectiles.

Extends:

Enemy: The base enemy class with AI and movement logic.

attack_radius

Distance within which the enemy can shoot.

Type:

float

color

Debug color for this enemy type.

Type:

Color

cooldown_timer

Time after which the enemy is allowed to shoot again.

Type:

int

shoot_cooldown

Delay between shots in milliseconds.

Type:

int

__init__(x, y)[source]

Initializes a RangedEnemy with projectile attack capabilities.

Parameters:

  • x (int) – X-coordinate on the map grid.

  • y (int) – Y-coordinate on the map grid.

draw(screen, camera)[source]

Draws the ranged enemy and optionally its hitbox if enabled.

Parameters:

  • screen (pygame.Surface) – The rendering surface.

  • camera (Camera) – Camera object for view transformation.

Returns:

None

prepare_attack(current_time)[source]

Prepares a ranged attack by entering a cooldown phase.

Parameters:

current_time (int) – Current game time in milliseconds.

Returns:

None

update(camera, player, game_map, projectiles, current_time)[source]

Updates enemy behavior, handling cooldown and projectile attacks.

Parameters:

  • camera (Camera) – Camera for coordinate transformation.

  • player (Player) – The player instance.

  • game_map (Map) – Current map for collision and visibility checks.

  • projectiles (list[Projectile]) – Active projectile list.

  • current_time (int) – Game time in milliseconds.

Returns:

None

HitBox

class entity.HitBox.RectangleHitbox.RectEntity(x, y, width, height, angle=0)[source]

Base class for rectangular entities with rotation and collision detection.

pos

Position of the entity center on the map.

Type:

pygame.Vector2

width

Width of the rectangle.

Type:

float

height

Height of the rectangle.

Type:

float

angle

Rotation angle in degrees.

Type:

float

color

Color used for rendering the hitbox.

Type:

tuple[int, int, int]

__init__(x, y, width, height, angle=0)[source]

Initializes a rectangular entity with a position, size, and angle.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – X-coordinate of the center.

  • y (float) – Y-coordinate of the center.

  • width (float) – Width of the rectangle.

  • height (float) – Height of the rectangle.

  • angle (float, optional) – Rotation angle in degrees. Defaults to 0.

collides_with_rect(other)[source]

Checks collision with another rectangular entity using polygon intersection.

Parameters:

other (RectEntity) – The other rectangle to check collision against.

Returns:

True if there is a collision, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

draw_hit_box(surface)[source]

Draws the hitbox polygon on the provided surface.

Parameters:

surface (pygame.Surface) – Surface to render the polygon on.

Returns:

None

get_corners()[source]

Calculates the corner points of the rectangle, considering rotation.

Returns:

List of 4 rotated corner positions.

Return type:

list[pygame.Vector2]

off_collision()[source]

Resets the entity’s color to green, indicating no collision.

Returns:

None

on_collision()[source]

Changes the entity’s color to red, indicating collision.

Returns:

None

update_angle(angle)[source]

Updates the rotation angle of the entity.

Parameters:

angle (float) – New angle in degrees.

Returns:

None

update_pos(x, y)[source]

Updates the position of the entity.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – New x-coordinate.

  • y (float) – New y-coordinate.

Returns:

None

Player

class entity.player.player.Player(x, y)[source]

The player character controlled by the user.

Inherits from:

RectEntity: Provides hitbox and collision capabilities.

x

Player’s x-position on the game grid.

Type:

float

y

Player’s y-position on the game grid.

Type:

float

center_x

Player’s center x-position on the screen (pixels).

Type:

int

center_y

Player’s center y-position on the screen (pixels).

Type:

int

speed

Movement speed of the player.

Type:

float

hp

Current hit points of the player.

Type:

int

max_hp

Maximum hit points of the player.

Type:

int

weapons

List of player’s weapons (melee and ranged).

Type:

list[Weapon]

current_weapon_id

Index of currently selected weapon.

Type:

int

weapon

Currently equipped weapon (can be melee or ranged).

Type:

Weapon

__init__(x, y)[source]

Initializes the player at a specific grid position.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – Starting x-position on the grid.

  • y (float) – Starting y-position on the grid.

attack(camera, current_time, projectiles, enemies, game_map)[source]

Performs an attack using the currently selected weapon.

Parameters:

  • camera (Camera) – Camera for position offset.

  • current_time (int) – Current game time in milliseconds.

  • projectiles (list[Projectile]) – List to append new projectiles (for ranged).

  • enemies (list[Enemy]) – List of enemies in range (for ranged).

  • game_map (Map) – The game map (for ranged line-of-sight).

Returns:

None

change_weapon_down()[source]

Switches to the previous weapon in the inventory (cyclic).

Returns:

None

change_weapon_up()[source]

Switches to the next weapon in the inventory (cyclic).

Returns:

None

Renders the player on the screen along with health bar and weapon indicators.

Parameters:

  • current_time (int) – Current time in milliseconds (used by weapon draw).

Returns:

None

Angle in degrees from the player to the mouse position.

float

dict

Moves the player by delta x and y, checking for wall collisions.

Parameters:

  • dx (float) – Change in x-direction.

  • dy (float) – Change in y-direction.

  • game_map (Map) – Game map used for wall collision detection.

Returns:

None

set_position(x, y)[source]

None

amount (int) – Amount of damage received.

Returns:

None

Updates player position and weapon logic.

Parameters:

  • camera (Camera) – Camera used to calculate screen-relative positions.

  • current_time (int) – Current game time in milliseconds.

None

class entity.player.player_projectile.PlayerProjectile(x, y, angle, damage, max_distance, speed=0.4)[source]

Projectile fired by the player, with damage, speed, and distance limitations.

Inherits from:

Projectile: Base class for projectile behavior and rendering.

origin_x

X-coordinate where the projectile was created.

Type:

float

origin_y

Y-coordinate where the projectile was created.

Type:

float

max_distance

Maximum distance the projectile can travel before deactivating.

Type:

float

speed

Speed of the projectile.

Type:

float

color

Color used to represent the projectile visually.

Type:

tuple[int, int, int]

__init__(x, y, angle, damage, max_distance, speed=0.4)[source]

Initializes a player projectile with specified position, direction, and properties.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – Starting x-position of the projectile.

  • y (float) – Starting y-position of the projectile.

  • angle (float) – Direction of movement in radians.

  • damage (int) – Amount of damage the projectile deals.

  • max_distance (float) – How far the projectile can travel before deactivating.

  • speed (float, optional) – Movement speed of the projectile. Defaults to 0.4.

draw(screen)[source]

Draws the projectile on the screen using screen coordinates.

Parameters:

screen (pygame.Surface) – Surface to draw the projectile on.

Returns:

None

update(game_map, player, enemies, camera)[source]

Updates the projectile’s position and checks for collisions and distance limits.

Movement is applied based on angle and speed. The projectile is deactivated if it: - Exceeds its max distance (currently commented out), - Collides with a wall, - Collides with any enemy.

Parameters:

  • game_map (Map) – Current map, used to check for wall collisions.

  • player (Player) – The player that fired the projectile (not currently used).

  • enemies (list[Enemy]) – List of potential enemy targets.

  • camera (Camera) – Camera for coordinate transformation (passed to super).

Returns:

None

Weapon

class entity.weapon.MeleeWeapon.MeleeWeapon(damage=15, cooldown=100, reach=2.0, swing_duration=300)[source]

Melee weapon class representing a swinging blade weapon.

Handles swing animation, collision detection with enemies, and cooldown management.

damage

Damage inflicted per hit.

Type:

int

cooldown

Minimum cooldown time in milliseconds between swings.

Type:

int

reach

Maximum reach of the weapon in pixels.

Type:

float

swing_duration

Duration of the swing animation in milliseconds.

Type:

int

player_direction

Angle (degrees) the player faces when starting attack.

Type:

float

is_attacking

Whether the weapon is currently swinging.

Type:

bool

swing_direction

Direction of the swing (angle in degrees).

Type:

float

attack_start_time

Timestamp when the current swing started.

Type:

int

hit_enemies

Set of enemies hit in the current swing to avoid multiple hits.

Type:

set

swing_start_angle

Initial angle of the swing animation relative to player direction.

Type:

float

swing_deviation

Total angular deviation of the swing (how wide the blade swings).

Type:

float

current_angle

Current angle of the blade during swing or idle.

Type:

float

handle_length

Length of the weapon handle in pixels.

Type:

float

blade_length

Length of the weapon blade in pixels.

Type:

float

__init__(damage=15, cooldown=100, reach=2.0, swing_duration=300)[source]

Initialize a MeleeWeapon instance.

Parameters:

  • damage (int, optional) – Damage inflicted by weapon hits. Default is 15.

  • cooldown (int, optional) – Cooldown time between attacks in milliseconds. Default is 100.

  • reach (float, optional) – Reach multiplier in tiles (converted to pixels). Default is 2.0.

  • swing_duration (int, optional) – Duration of swing animation in milliseconds. Default is 300.

attack(x, y, direction, current_time, **kwargs)[source]

Initiates a melee attack swing if the cooldown has elapsed and no current attack is active.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – X-coordinate for the attack origin (unused here).

  • y (float) – Y-coordinate for the attack origin (unused here).

  • direction (float) – Player’s facing direction in degrees at attack start.

  • current_time (int) – Current time in milliseconds.

Returns:

True if attack started, False otherwise (e.g., on cooldown or already attacking).

Return type:

bool

draw(screen, player, current_time)[source]

Draws the weapon on the screen.

Parameters:

  • screen (pygame.Surface) – Pygame surface to draw on.

  • player (Player) – Player instance for position reference.

  • current_time (int) – Current time in milliseconds.

get_attack_direction()[source]

Returns the direction angle the player faced at the start of the attack.

Returns:

Attack start direction in degrees.

Return type:

float

get_attack_progress()[source]

Returns the current progress of the attack swing.

Returns:

Value between 0.0 (start) and 1.0 (end) indicating swing progress.

Return type:

float

get_debug_info(player)[source]

Returns a dictionary of debug info related to the weapon state.

Parameters:

player (Player) – Player instance.

Returns:

Debug information including weapon position and angle.

Return type:

dict

get_weapon_pos(player)[source]

Returns the weapon’s current position in pixels relative to the player.

Parameters:

player (Player) – Player instance with grid position attributes.

Returns:

(x, y) position of the weapon in pixels.

Return type:

tuple[int, int]

update(current_time, player, enemies=None)[source]

Updates the swing animation state and checks for enemy collisions during an active swing.

Parameters:

  • current_time (int) – Current time in milliseconds.

  • player (Player) – Player instance with positional and directional info.

  • enemies (list, optional) – List of enemy objects to check collision against.

class entity.weapon.RangedWeapon.RangedWeapon(damage=8, range=5.0, cooldown=300, projectile_speed=0.4)[source]

RangedWeapon class represents a weapon that fires projectiles.

damage

The amount of damage dealt by each projectile.

Type:

int

range

Maximum range (distance) the projectile can travel (in some unit, e.g., tiles).

Type:

float

cooldown

Time in milliseconds between consecutive attacks.

Type:

int

projectile_speed

Speed at which the projectile travels.

Type:

float

color

RGB color used for drawing the weapon (optional).

Type:

tuple

name

Weapon name identifier.

Type:

str

__init__(damage=8, range=5.0, cooldown=300, projectile_speed=0.4)[source]

Initialize a ranged weapon with given parameters.

Parameters:

  • damage (int) – Damage per projectile (default 8).

  • range (float) – Maximum range of projectile in game units (default 5.0).

  • cooldown (int) – Attack cooldown in milliseconds (default 300).

  • projectile_speed (float) – Projectile movement speed (default 0.4).

attack(x, y, direction, current_time, projectiles=None, **kwargs)[source]

Perform an attack by firing a projectile if cooldown permits.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – Starting x position of the projectile (usually player’s position).

  • y (float) – Starting y position of the projectile.

  • direction (float) – Attack direction angle in degrees.

  • current_time (int) – Current game time in milliseconds.

  • projectiles (list) – Optional list to append newly created projectiles to.

  • **kwargs – Additional optional parameters.

Returns:

True if attack was successful (projectile fired), False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

draw(screen, player, current_time)[source]

Draw the ranged weapon on the screen.

Parameters:

  • screen (pygame.Surface) – The surface to draw on.

  • player (Player) – The player holding the weapon.

  • current_time (int) – Current game time in milliseconds.

get_debug_info(player)[source]
update(current_time, player, enemies=None, **kwargs)[source]

Update the weapon state each frame. Updates the weapon’s angle to face the mouse cursor and positions it relative to the player.

Parameters:

  • current_time (int) – Current game time in milliseconds.

  • player (Player) – The player object holding the weapon.

  • enemies (list, optional) – List of enemies (not used here but available).

  • **kwargs – Additional optional parameters.

class entity.weapon.weapon.Weapon(x, y, width, length, damage=10, cooldown=50)[source]

Base weapon class providing common weapon functionality.

Extends:

RectEntity: For position and collision hitbox handling.

damage

Damage dealt by the weapon per attack.

Type:

int

cooldown

Minimum cooldown time between attacks in milliseconds.

Type:

int

last_attack_time

Timestamp of the last attack.

Type:

int

weapon_type

Type of weapon (MELEE or RANGED).

Type:

WeaponType or None

__init__(x, y, width, length, damage=10, cooldown=50)[source]

Initializes a weapon instance.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – X-coordinate position.

  • y (float) – Y-coordinate position.

  • width (float) – Width of the weapon’s hitbox.

  • length (float) – Length of the weapon’s hitbox.

  • damage (int, optional) – Damage inflicted by the weapon. Defaults to 10.

  • cooldown (int, optional) – Cooldown time in milliseconds between attacks. Defaults to 50.

attack(x, y, direction, current_time, **kwargs)[source]

Attempts to perform an attack action.

Should be overridden by subclasses for specific attack behavior.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – X-coordinate of attack origin.

  • y (float) – Y-coordinate of attack origin.

  • direction (any) – Direction of attack (type dependent on subclass).

  • current_time (int) – Current time in milliseconds.

  • **kwargs – Additional optional parameters.

Returns:

True if attack was performed, False if weapon is on cooldown.

Return type:

bool

can_attack(current_time)[source]

Checks if the weapon can perform an attack based on its cooldown timer.

Parameters:

current_time (int) – Current time in milliseconds.

Returns:

True if cooldown period has passed and weapon can attack, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

point_on_line_at_distance(a, b, n)[source]

Calculates a point along the line segment from point a to b at a distance n from a.

Parameters:

  • a (tuple[float, float]) – Starting point coordinates (x, y).

  • b (tuple[float, float]) – Ending point coordinates (x, y).

  • n (float) – Distance from point a along the line toward point b.

Returns:

Coordinates of the point at distance n along the line.

Return type:

tuple[float, float]
